reference.title: support for SQL:2011 features
reference.shortdesc: The SQL:2011 standard puts features into two categories, mandatory and optional.

section.p: In the tables that follow, the support status of each feature is indicated as follows:

li.p: Yes*: The feature is supported (for example, through JDBC) but not according to the SQL standard. See Note for details.
Partial: The feature is partially supported.

section.p: supports many features of the SQL:2011 standard. Most are in Part 2 (Foundation), but some are in other parts. The supported optional features with the prefix J are in Part 13 (JRT). The supported optional features with the prefix X are in Part 14 (SQL/XML).
lists the features in Part 2 that does not support.

section.title: Support for mandatory features
section.p: The following tables describe support for SQL:2011 mandatory features.

table.title: E011: Numeric data types
table.desc: This table describes support for E011, numeric data types.

row.entry: INTEGER and SMALLINT data types (including all spellings)
REAL, DOUBLE PRECISION, and FLOAT data types
Implicit casting among the numeric data types

table.title: E021: Character data types
table.desc: This table describes support for E021, character data types.

row.entry: CHARACTER data type (including all its spellings)
CHARACTER VARYING data type (including all its spellings)
Called LENGTH. {fn LENGTH(...)} is according to JDBC specification.
Called SUBSTR. {fn SUBSTRING(....)} is according to JDBC specification.
Implicit casting among the character data types
Called LOCATE. {fn LOCATE(...)} is according to JDBC specification.

table.title: E031: Identifiers
table.desc: This table describes support for E031, identifiers.

table.title: E051: Basic query specification
table.desc: This table describes support for E051, basic query specification.

row.entry: GROUP BY can contain columns not in select-list
Select list items can be renamed
Correlation names in the FROM clause
Rename columns in the FROM clause

table.title: E061: Basic predicates and search conditions
table.desc: This table describes support for E061, basic predicates and search conditions.

row.entry: IN predicate with list of values

table.title: E071: Basic query expressions
table.desc: This table describes support for E071, basic query expressions.

row.entry: Columns combined via table operators need not have exactly the same data type

table.title: E081: Basic privileges
table.desc: This table describes support for E081, basic privileges.

row.entry: SELECT privilege at the table level
INSERT privilege at the table level
UPDATE privilege at the table level
UPDATE privilege at the column level
REFERENCES privilege at the table level
REFERENCES privilege at the column level

table.title: E091: Set functions
table.desc: This table describes support for E091, set functions.

table.title: E101: Basic data manipulation
table.desc: This table describes support for E101, basic data manipulation.

table.title: E121: Basic cursor support (through JDBC)
table.desc: This table describes support for E121, basic cursor support.

row.entry: ORDER BY columns need not be in select list
Value expressions in ORDER BY clause

table.title: E141: Basic integrity constraints
table.desc: This table describes support for E141, basic integrity constraints.

row.entry: UNIQUE constraints of NOT NULL columns
Basic FOREIGN KEY constraint with the NO ACTION default
NOT NULL inferred on PRIMARY KEY
Names in a foreign key can be specified in any order

table.title: E151: Transaction support
table.desc: This table describes support for E151, transaction support.

row.entry: Through JDBC Connection.commit, ij supports COMMIT statement
Through JDBC Connection.rollback, ij supports ROLLBACK statement

table.title: E152: Basic SET TRANSACTION statement
table.desc: This table describes support for E152, basic SET TRANSACTION statement.

row.entry: SET TRANSACTION statement: ISOLATION LEVEL SERIALIZABLE clause
SET [CURRENT] ISOLATION SERIALIZABLE. Connection.setTransactionIsolation( Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE) is according to JDBC specification.
SET TRANSACTION statement: READ ONLY and READ WRITE clauses
No SQL syntax. Connection.setReadWrite() is according to JDBC specification.

table.title: F031: Basic schema manipulation
table.desc: This table describes support for F031, basic schema manipulation.

row.entry: CREATE TABLE statement to create persistent base tables
ALTER TABLE statement: ADD COLUMN clause

table.title: F041: Basic joined tables
table.desc: This table describes support for F041, basic joined tables.

row.entry: Inner join (but not necessarily the INNER keyword)
The inner table in a left or right outer join can also be used in an inner join
All comparison operators are supported (rather than just =)

table.title: F051: Basic date and time
table.desc: This table describes support for F051, basic date and time.

row.entry: DATE literal is implemented as built-in function. {d 'yyyy-mm-ff'} is according to JDBC specification.
TIME data type (including TIME literal) with fractional seconds precision of 0
TIME literal is implemented as built-in function. No precision in datatype. {t' hh:mm:ss'} is according to JDBC specification.
TIMESTAMP data type (including TIMESTAMP literal) with fractional seconds precision of 0 and 6
TIMESTAMP literal is implemented as built-in function. No precision in datatype. No timezone in datatype. {ts 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.f...'} is according to JDBC specification.
Comparison predicate on DATE, TIME, and TIMESTAMP data types
Explicit CAST between datetime types and character types
No time zone in datetime value expression
{fn CURTIME()} is according to JDBC specification

table.title: F131: Grouped operations
table.desc: This table describes support for F131, grouped operations.

row.entry: WHERE, GROUP BY, and HAVING clauses supported in queries with grouped views
Multiple tables supported in queries with grouped views
Set functions supported in queries with grouped views
Subqueries with GROUP BY and HAVING clauses and grouped views
Single row SELECT with GROUP BY and HAVING clauses and grouped views

table.title: F261: CASE expression
table.desc: This table describes support for F261, CASE expression.

table.title: F311: Schema definition statement
table.desc: This table describes support for F311, schema definition statement.

row.entry: CREATE TABLE for persistent base tables

table.title: T321: Basic SQL invoked routines
table.desc: This table describes support for T321, basic SQL invoked routines.

row.entry: User-defined stored procedures with no overloading

table.title: Miscellaneous mandatory features
table.desc: This table describes support for miscellaneous mandatory features.

row.entry: Null value support (nulls in lieu of values)
SQL comments using leading double minus
IN predicate with one list element

section.title: Support for optional features
section.p: The following tables show support for SQL:2011 optional features.

table.title: F111: Isolation levels other than SERIALIZABLE
table.desc: This table describes support for F111, isolation levels other than SERIALIZABLE.

table.title: F302: INTERSECT table operator
table.desc: This table describes support for F302, INTERSECT table operator.

table.title: F381: Extended schema manipulation
table.desc: This table describes support for F381, extended schema manipulation.

row.entry: ALTER TABLE statement: ALTER COLUMN clause
ALTER TABLE statement: ADD CONSTRAINT clause
ALTER TABLE statement: DROP CONSTRAINT clause

table.title: F401: Extended joined table
table.desc: This table describes support for F401, extended joined table.

table.title: F831: Full cursor update
table.desc: This table describes support for F831, full cursor update.

table.title: T041: Basic LOB data type support
table.desc: This table describes support for T041, basic LOB data type support.

row.entry: POSITION, LENGTH, LOWER, TRIM, UPPER, and SUBSTRING functions for LOB data types
Not standard SQL syntax. See notes on features E021-04, E021-06, E021-09 and E021-11

table.title: T211: Basic trigger capability
table.desc: This table describes support for T211, basic trigger capability.

row.entry: Triggers activated on UPDATE, INSERT, or DELETE of one base table
Need to specify non-standard ON CASCADE BEFORE. Before triggers cannot have INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statements as their action
Ability to specify a search condition that shall be True before the trigger is invoked
Support for run-time rules for the interaction of triggers and constraints
Multiple triggers for the same event are executed in the order in which they were created in the catalog

table.title: Miscellaneous optional features
table.desc: This table describes support for miscellaneous optional features.

row.entry: ALTER TABLE statement: DROP COLUMN clause
Comma-separated predicates in simple CASE expression

You can alter only VARCHAR, VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA, BLOB, and CLOB columns, and you can change only the length. That is, you can change the data type from VARCHAR(10) to VARCHAR(100), but not from VARCHAR(10) to CLOB(100).
Named column joins for LOBs, arrays, and multisets
Global tables (DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement)
Users can create a database with territory-based collation
Deferrable NOT NULL constraints are not supported
Non-standard syntax (CURRENT SCHEMA instead of CURRENT_SCHEMA), and it is not allowed in a DEFAULT clause
DISTINCT in more than one aggregate function will not work, but SELECT DISTINCT with DISTINCT in one aggregate function will work
Dynamic <fetch first row count> in <fetch first clause>
Dynamic <offset row count> in <result offset clause>
Non-standard type names CHAR FOR BIT DATA and VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA instead of BINARY and VARBINARY
CAST and string value functions implemented. No comparison or ordering.
MAXVALUE and CYCLE not supported. Deviation from standard: A comma (,) is required before INCREMENT.
ALTER SEQUENCE not supported. Only one NEXT VALUE FOR clause per sequence in each statement
Partial support for GROUP BY ROLLUP
UNIQUE constraints of possibly null columns
XMLParse: Character string input and DOCUMENT option
No support for the STRIP WHITESPACE option
Support only for XPath queries, not full XQuery
Support only for XPath queries, not full XQuery
